content: Hello, I want to ask about credit cards.

For a first-time cardholder, the BPI Rewards Card is the most accessible option with an annual income requirement of Php 180,000 (equivalent to Php 15,000 monthly). It carries a Php 1,550 annual fee, earns 1 BPI Point for every Php 35 spent, and comes with free travel insurance up to Php 2 million. The BPI eCredit Card is also worth considering as it has no annual fee and serves as a secure companion card for online purchases.

response.message: Hello, I want to ask about credit cards.

suggestions.suggestion: For a first-time cardholder, the BPI Rewards Card is the most accessible option with an annual income requirement of Php 180,000 (equivalent to Php 15,000 monthly). It carries a Php 1,550 annual fee, earns 1 BPI Point for every Php 35 spent, and comes with free travel insurance up to Php 2 million. The BPI eCredit Card is also worth considering as it has no annual fee and serves as a secure companion card for online purchases.

If you're looking for premium benefits, the BPI Signature Card offers enhanced rewards but requires a higher income bracket and comes with a Php 5,500 annual fee. The BPI Platinum Rewards Card (mentioned in Moneymax reviews) provides accelerated points earning and exclusive privileges, though specific income requirements aren't detailed in the retrieved documents.

Beyond annual fees, be aware of other charges: cash advance fee is a flat Php 200 per transaction plus 3% monthly finance charge. Foreign transactions incur 1.85% fee (0.85% BPI fee + 1% Mastercard/Visa assessment). Late payment penalties apply, though exact amounts aren't specified in the retrieved documents.

While the documents confirm the Php 180,000 annual income requirement for the BPI Rewards Card, specific credit limits aren't provided. Your actual limit will be determined after BPI's evaluation of your income documents and credit history. Ensure your documented income meets or exceeds Php 15,000 monthly for the Rewards Card tier.

All BPI credit cards allow you to shop with special promotions and convert purchases into flexible installments. The Rewards Card's point system lets you redeem from a wide catalog of items, while the free travel insurance provides coverage for both domestic and international trips. Check BPI's current promotions page for ongoing deals when using your card for purchases.

content: I usually travel a lot. what should i get

For frequent travelers, I recommend the BPI Signature Card - it offers 2 BPI Points per Php 20 spent, 3x points on overseas purchases, unlimited airport lounge access worldwide, and travel insurance up to Php 20 million. Annual income requirement is Php 1.2M with Php 5,500 fee.

response.message: I usually travel a lot. what should i get

suggestions.suggestion: For frequent travelers, I recommend the BPI Signature Card - it offers 2 BPI Points per Php 20 spent, 3x points on overseas purchases, unlimited airport lounge access worldwide, and travel insurance up to Php 20 million. Annual income requirement is Php 1.2M with Php 5,500 fee.

content: What documents do I need to apply?

For your chosen travel-focused card, you'll need to prepare these documents based on your income source: If employed, bring your Certificate of Employment (COE), latest 3 months payslips, or latest Income Tax Return (ITR) with BIR/bank stamp. For self-employed applicants, prepare your Latest Audited Financial Statements (AFS) and latest ITR with BIR/bank stamp. OFWs need POEA-Validated Contract of Employment and latest 2 months proof of remittance. Additionally, all applicants must submit at least one valid, unexpired government-issued photo-bearing ID such as PhilID, Passport, Driver's License, SSS ID, PRC ID, or UMID.

For self-employed applicants, prepare your Latest Audited Financial Statements (AFS) and latest ITR with BIR/bank stamp. OFWs need POEA-Validated Contract of Employment and latest 2 months proof of remittance. Additionally, all applicants must submit at least one valid, unexpired government-issued photo-bearing ID such as PhilID, Passport, Driver's License, SSS ID, PRC ID, or UMID.

You can conveniently start your credit card application online through the BPI website. The digital application process allows you to upload all required documents electronically, making it perfect for your digital banking preference. Simply visit the BPI credit cards application page to begin your submission.

For personalized guidance on document requirements specific to your situation, you can contact BPI through their official channels or schedule a branch appointment. If you have unique income sources or are a foreign resident, speaking with a BPI specialist will ensure you have the exact documentation needed for your application.

content: You're welcome! When you're ready to apply, you can visit any BPI branch or apply online through the BPI Mobile app. Is there anything else about credit cards or other banking services I can help you with?
